alert.note: Alert for Green Mountains and Rattlesnake Range; Lander Foothills; Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southwest Big Horn Basin; Upper Wind River Basin; Wind River Basin; Wind River Mountains East (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 10 at 6:11PM MST by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW TO IMPACT THE WIND RIVER BASIN... HAZARDS...An area of moderate to heavy snow accompanied by winds of up to 40 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one mile. Brief reductions to under a quarter mile is possible. Snow accumulations between a half and one inch could occur mainly in grassy areas. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 608 PM MST, an area of moderate to heavy snow was along a line extending from 20 miles north of Pavillion through Morton to around Lander moving east between 30 and 40 MPH. THIS AREA OF HEAVY SNOW WILL BE NEAR... Hudson around 620 PM Riverton around 630 PM Shoshoni around 645 PM. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this area of heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. &&

area.areaDesc: Green Mountains and Rattlesnake Range; Lander Foothills; Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southwest Big Horn Basin; Upper Wind River Basin; Wind River Basin; Wind River Mountains East
